summary: Phoebe Curtis Orr is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certification reports from February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. These documents list her name alongside other committee staff, indicating she was compensated for her work during these periods. The payroll certifications confirm that she performed her assigned duties during the specified accounting periods.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Phoebe Curtis Orr's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications document her employment and compensation, providing a record of personnel involved in the committee's work.
